channel.title: I need help with my C4D sword
channel.description: I need help with my C4D sword this is how far i have got http://img214.imageshack.us/my.php?image=swordlm3.jpg but it is not 3D how do thicken it?

item.title: I need help with my C4D sword
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“kohl baker, post:10, topic:255741”][quote author=io9 link=topic=337909.msg2623166#msg2623166 date=1231608362]
protip: op is a moparscaper.
[/quote]W.T.F does that mean?[/quote]
i lol’d

Read full topic
item.source: I need help with my C4D sword

item.title: I need help with my C4D sword
item.dc:creator: @kohl_baker kohl baker
item.description:
@kohl_baker wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:5, topic:255741”]protip: op is a moparscaper.[/quote]W.T.F does that mean?
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 10, 2009, 01:29:11 pm[/size][hr][quote=“SomethingToHide, post:7, topic:255741”][quote author=io9 link=topic=337909.msg2623166#msg2623166 date=1231608362]
protip: op is a moparscaper.
[/quote]

True dat.
But at least he’s trying… a little.

When I first started I also tried a sword. Turned out terrible though.[/quote]i started with chess pieces and i lost the files then i made a sword…=)

Read full topic
item.source: I need help with my C4D sword

item.title: I need help with my C4D sword
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

That’s not too bad as far as models go. The hilt could benefit from some smoothing and small bevels.

If you textured some awesome vector ivy victorian something or the other design on that blade, that would be tighttttt.

Read full topic
item.source: I need help with my C4D sword

lol i don’t really like dealing with swords, but the other day i made a 300 sword while i was watching 300.

item.title: I need help with my C4D sword
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Or just do both sides, select both sides’ edges, and bevel them at the same time.

Read full topic
item.source: I need help with my C4D sword

item.title: I need help with my C4D sword
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

I would break it, Actually, i would only just draw the blade.

Then bevel one side, and look at the amount, then use ‘close polygon hole’ on the other side, then bevel that the same amount.

Read full topic
item.source: I need help with my C4D sword

item.title: I need help with my C4D sword
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

You can do it a few ways.
Select all polygons and use the extrude tool.
Or put an extrudenurbs on the object.
I’d do it the first way.

And break the sword into two objects, the blade and the hilt first.

Read full topic
item.source: I need help with my C4D sword
